intro: Metrosideros tardiflora, commonly known as the late-flowering pohutukawa, is a species of flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive red flowers that bloom late in the year, typically from late autumn to early spring. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, white pubescence. It thrives in coastal and forested areas, often growing on cliffs or along riverbanks. Metrosideros tardiflora is well adapted to the temperate climate of New Zealand and plays an important role in local ecosystems.
